comment: Dr. Hauser is a great professor and knows her international relations stuff. Weekly discussion posts, replies, and chapter tests make up the work. She posts helpful lecture videos too. Grading is fair and the material is interesting. Just do the readings and you'll do well.
This is a very easy class. She gives you a lot of extra credit opportunities. All you have to do in this class is write a discussion, journals, and take a quiz every week.

Straightforward enjoyable lectures based on textbook material, very accessible during and outside of class. Took in Spring 2023. Most difficult parts of the class were the discussion posts & some exam questions. Overall great class!
this professor is great! Easy A class, you dont even have to read textbook just take notes in class and you will be fine.

I found the class challenging due to the emphasis on memorization. Attendance & attention are crucial. If you have health issues, think twice before taking this class. Tons of info covered on the only 2 tests, midterm & final, so study. She's known for being kind & approachable & supportive learning environment. Lots of extra credit opportunities.

Responded to emails fast. Allows for extra credit opportunities on tests and on projects. Not too harsh of a grader. Textbook heavy with assignments related to the textbook. The weekly quizzes and assignments have 3 attempts each, so getting a 100 is very easy. Provides study guide for each test. Posts helpful lecture videos. Take her if possible.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Ms. Hauser was such an easy class to take. I tried to take American Gov twice and drop them but with Ms Hauser it was so easy. Her class is the same routine every week, 4 assignments that have 3 questions, a quiz due, discussion post her a journal that only needs 150 words. Super easy class!
Dr. Hauser is a very good professor. She knows what she's talking about and her lectures prepare you for the exams and projects.

Dr. Hauser is great!  She knows what she's talking about, her class discussions are fun and engaging, and you feel like you take something away from them.  She does have a good amount of supplementary readings, so if you hate reading she may not be your favorite.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Hauser is so sweet and caring and flexible! We asked for a day extension on our paper in order to apply the feedback from our peer reviews. I loved how she used the ppt and the whiteboard for the lectures, and it also involved the class. Great professor and I am so glad she is at KSU!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Very good teacher! I took government online and it was very easy, discussion posts, in textbook quizzes and journal assignments. I often turned in work late and received no penalties! She gave great feedback on discussion posts. Final project was easy too! Easy A for sure.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Do assignments on time

Dr Hauser is an incredible professor. She generally issues a lot of reading and expects students to be able to have in-depth conversations about the readings. This class had 4 tests. You would pick 2 of the 3 long answer questions to answer. She expects a tremendous amount of detail so do not procrastinate these. Overall learned a lot in her class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This class online was super easy. This class is laid out perfectly and Hauser is super sweet. Each week theres small assignments due in the textbook, a test in the textbook, a discussion post, and a current event journal every other week. I never read the textbook and passed with an A. Super easy class I highly recommend.

Very extensive, but be warned, there's A LOT due every week. Luckily, she's very clear about grading dates, but it was just a lot of work and reading every week. Seriously, like by far the class I had the most work in every week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Although I didn't appreciate some of her ego moments, Professor Hauser is nonetheless knowledgeable, organized her class efficiently, and mostly grades according to the work put into an assignment. Lots of discussion posts, and a few written exams (open-note & book). Work hard, reach out if necessary (she will respond), and get the deserved grade.
Took her summer 2022 online, very easy going with clear instructions. As long as you do the work she isnt a harsh grader at all.

Had her for 2250, idk y that isn't an option on RMP. She encouraged us to engage in discussions and helped us really understand the material, not just memorize facts. She's very understanding if you have an issue, just talk to her. Easy grader. Just be sure to check the syllabus for due dates, because she forgets to tell you.

There are discussion posts, mini quizzes, and a test on the textbook reading due each week. It can be a bit of work, but if you stay on top of it you will be fine. None of the material is super hard at all. There are a total of three exams throughout the semester, I didn't do too well on them but still ended the class with an A.

Easy class test and dissuasion every week 
exams low stakes: there are 3 test 8% each lockdown 

Professor good 

overall easy
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Hauser is knowledgeable, but learning from her is hard. Her tests are short answer with about 4 other question within the 1 being asked, but so are her discussions. Her "study guides" only include overviews of what you need to know and do not really pin point the questions that are going to be on the exam.
I enjoyed Dr. Hauser's class, workload was clear and well instructed. Easy A/B if you do your work, Dr. Hauser is very active in group discussions which I really enjoyed!
This professor is great. Took this class online and it was so easy. Tests can be difficult but she gives so many easy assignments to make up for it. Take this class, its great!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Prof Hauser is a great professor that actually interacts with her students work and gives great feedback. There are a lot of assignments but they are quick and straight forward. The tests require a lot of studying but if you do that you will get a good grade. She drops a lot of your lowest grades making it almost impossible to fail. Take her class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hauser is very nice as a person but I think her teaching style is very boring. She makes us do discussion boards and read the textbook to answer questions. I just hate that the exams are short essay answers and one long essay and not multiple-choice, which makes it harder than it needs to be.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Great Professor! Gives great feedback on Discussion Posts. Gives extra credit opportunities and will help you bring your grade up if you are trying. Always responds to emails and is willing to answer any questions. The tests are not difficult at all because she gives helpful study guides for them. BEST CLASS & PROFESSOR EVER.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Hauser is one of the best professors Ive ever had. Shes always an email away. The textbook used in class is very up to date which makes the assignments more engaging. Theres a discussion post and multiple choice test every week, but if you read the text book its an easy A.
